title: Sandro Acerbo
text:
Sandro Acerbo (born Alessandro Ancidoni; September 5, 1955) is an Italian <a href="voice%20actor">voice actor</a>.
Biography.
Born in Rome, Acerbo began his dubbing career as a child. Among his most earliest roles include Michael Banks (portrayed by <a href="Matthew%20Garber">Matthew Garber</a>) in the 1964 film "<a href="Mary%20Poppins%20%28film%29">Mary Poppins</a>". He also served as the Italian voice of Patch in "<a href="One%20Hundred%20and%20One%20Dalmatians">One Hundred and One Dalmatians</a>", Hathi Jr. in "<a href="The%20Jungle%20Book%20%281967%20film%29">The Jungle Book</a>" and Kurt Von Trapp in "<a href="The%20Sound%20of%20Music%20%28film%29">The Sound of Music</a>".
Even as an adult, Acerbo continued dubbing characters into the Italian language. He is the official Italian voice of <a href="Brad%20Pitt">Brad Pitt</a> and <a href="Will%20Smith">Will Smith</a> as well as occasionally dubbing <a href="Hugh%20Grant">Hugh Grant</a>, <a href="Dan%20Aykroyd">Dan Aykroyd</a>, <a href="Robert%20Downey%20Jr.">Robert Downey Jr.</a>, <a href="Matthew%20Broderick">Matthew Broderick</a>, <a href="Val%20Kilmer">Val Kilmer</a>, <a href="Michael%20J.%20Fox">Michael J. Fox</a> and <a href="Timothy%20Hutton">Timothy Hutton</a> in some of their movies. Acerbo is most popular for voicing <a href="Marty%20McFly">Marty McFly</a> in the last two films of the "<a href="Back%20to%20the%20Future%20%28franchise%29">Back to the Future</a>" film series, replacing <a href="Teo%20Bellia">Teo Bellia</a>. He also became the new voice dubber of <a href="Eddie%20Murphy">Eddie Murphy</a> after the death of <a href="Tonino%20Accolla">Tonino Accolla</a> in 2013 even though the role was passed on to him in 2009.
Personal life.
Acerbo is the older brother of voice actress Rossella Acerbo and former voice actor Maurizio Ancidoni and the cousin of voice actors <a href="Fabrizio%20Manfredi">Fabrizio</a> and Massimiliano Manfredi. He is also married with two children. Since Maurizio Ancidoni's death in 2019, Acerbo took over as the CEO and general manager of the dubbing company .
